div.a:
COVID-19 and Ray USD
School Closure Information

div.p: The mission of the District is to provide comprehensive, success-oriented learning activities for young people in our schools. These opportunities must be designed to develop the person's potential in the areas of character, academic ability and vocational awareness, cultural appreciation, physical well-being, civic awareness, social development, and community contribution.

td.a: Ray HS Guidance Office News: ACT Information

img.br: Unfortunately due to COVID-19 the ACT test will not be re-scheduled for the Class of 2021 to take this school year. Therefore, those of you who need to take it will have to register on-line with ACT, and pay the fee, to take it on one of their scheduled Saturday National Testing Dates either this summer or early fall. The cost is $52 for the No Writing option and $68 for the Writing option.

td.a: CAC "Promise for the Future" Pledge Information for 8th Grade Students

img.br: Please visit our COVID-19 and School Closure Information page...

td.a: UPDATE: Ray Unified School District No. 3 to Offer Free Breakfast and Lunch to Children 18 and Under

img.br:
Starting Monday, March 23, grab and go meals will be provided at the locations listed below. All children 18 and under are eligible to participate.
Monday, March 23rd to Friday, March 27th - Breakfast/Lunch distributed each day
Monday, March 30th until School Resumes -- Breakfast /Lunch distributed Monday thru Thursday (Fridays meal will be distributed each Thursday - children will receive two meals).

td.a: RUSD School Closure COVID Parent Survey

img.br: RUSD is gathering data to determine the best possible way to provide instruction to our students during school closure. Would you please take a few minutes to complete the following survey (link below)? Please complete the survey for each child that attends Ray USD. This information will also allow teachers to communicate with students during this time.
